snippet: The growth of social media has spawned a national holiday — sometimes two — for seemingly every day of the year. It is an instinct as old as America itself.
abstract: Social media has helped draw attention to strange holidays like National Watermelon Day, which had previously been known only to small groups of insiders; advent of social media has also diminished role of trade groups, which are incidentally responsible for creation of some such holidays.
lead_paragraph: The growth of social media has spawned a national holiday — sometimes two — for seemingly every day of the year. It is an instinct as old as America itself.

headline.main: Need a Reason to Celebrate? Check Online, Where Social Media Fills the Calendar
headline.print_headline: Need a Reason to Celebrate? Check Online
